paragraphs.text: In this past year, my family and I have been inspired by the courage and hope we have seen in so many ways in Britain, in the Commonwealth and around the world.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ðɪs pɑːst jɪər, maɪ ˈfæmɪli ænd aɪ hæv biːn ɪnˈspaɪəd baɪ ðə ˈkʌrɪʤ ænd həʊp wiː hæv siːn ɪn səʊ ˈmɛni weɪz ɪn ˈbrɪtən, ɪn ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ ænd əˈraʊnd ðə wɜːld/

analysis.purpose: Open with a message of inspiration

paragraphs.text: We have seen that it is in hardship that we often find strength from our families.
paragraphs.ipa: /wiː hæv siːn ðæt ɪt ɪz ɪn ˈhɑːdʃɪp ðæt wiː ˈɒfən faɪnd strɛŋθ frɒm ˈaʊə ˈfæmɪliz/

paragraphs.text: It is in adversity that new friendships are sometimes formed and it is in a crisis that communities break down barriers and bind together to help one another.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz ɪn ədˈvɜːsɪti ðæt njuː ˈfrɛndʃɪps ɑː ˈsʌmtaɪmz fɔːmd ænd ɪt ɪz ɪn ə ˈkraɪsɪs ðæt kəˈmjuːnɪtiz breɪk daʊn ˈbærɪəz ænd baɪnd təˈɡɛðə tuː hɛlp wʌn əˈnʌðə/

paragraphs.text: Friends and neighbors often find a source of courage rising up from within.
paragraphs.ipa: /frɛndz ænd ˈneɪbəz ˈɒfən faɪnd ə sɔːs əv ˈkʌrɪʤ ˈraɪzɪŋ ʌp frɒm wɪˈðɪn/

paragraphs.text: Indeed, sadly, it seems that it is tragedy that often draws out the most and the best from the human spirit.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪnˈdiːd, ˈsædli, ɪt siːmz ðæt ɪt ɪz ˈtræʤədi ðæt ˈɒfən drɔːz aʊt ðə məʊst ænd ðə bɛst frɒm ðə ˈhjuːmən ˈspɪrɪt/

analysis.purpose: Reflect on the positive outcomes of tragedy

paragraphs.text: When Prince Philip and I visited Australia this year, we saw for ourselves the effects of natural disaster in some of the areas devastated by floods.
paragraphs.ipa: /wɛn prɪns ˈfɪlɪp ænd aɪ ˈvɪzɪtɪd ɒˈstreɪliə ðɪs jɪər, wiː sɔː fɔːr aʊəˈsɛlvz ði ɪˈfɛkts əv ˈnæʧrəl dɪˈzɑːstər ɪn sʌm əv ði ˈeərɪəz ˈdɛvəsteɪtɪd baɪ flʌdz/

paragraphs.text: In January, so many people lost their lives and their livelihoods.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ˈʤænjʊəri, səʊ ˈmɛni ˈpiːpl lɒst ðeə laɪvz ænd ðeə ˈlaɪvlihʊdz/

paragraphs.text: We were moved by the way families and local communities held together to support each other.
paragraphs.ipa: /wiː wɜː muːvd baɪ ðə weɪ ˈfæmɪliz ænd ˈləʊkəl kəˈmjuːnɪtiz hɛld təˈɡɛðə tuː səˈpɔːrt iːʧ ˈʌðə/

paragraphs.text: Prince William travelled to New Zealand and Australia in the aftermath of earthquakes, cyclones and floods, and saw how communities rose up to rescue the injured, comfort the bereaved and rebuild the cities and towns devastated by nature.
paragraphs.ipa: /prɪns ˈwɪljəm ˈtrævəld tuː njuː ˈziːlənd ænd ɒˈstreɪliə ɪn ði ˈɑːftəmæθ əv ˈɜːθkweɪks, ˈsaɪkləʊnz ænd flʌdz, ænd sɔː haʊ kəˈmjuːnɪtiz rəʊz ʌp tuː ˈrɛskjuː ði ˈɪnʤəd, ˈkʌmfət ðə bɪˈriːvd ænd ˌriːˈbɪld ðə ˈsɪtiz ænd taʊnz ˈdɛvəsteɪtɪd baɪ ˈneɪʧə/

analysis.purpose: Illustrate resilience in the face of disaster

paragraphs.text: The Prince of Wales also saw firsthand the remarkable resilience of the human spirit after tragedy struck in a world-finding community and how communities can work together to support their neighbours.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə prɪns əv weɪlz ˈɔːlsəʊ sɔː ˈfɜːsthænd ðə rɪˈmɑːkəbl rɪˈzɪliəns əv ðə ˈhjuːmən ˈspɪrɪt ˈɑːftə ˈtræʤədi strʌk ɪn ə wɜːld-ˈfaɪndɪŋ kəˈmjuːnɪti ænd haʊ kəˈmjuːnɪtiz kæn wɜːk təˈɡɛðə tuː səˈpɔːt ðeə ˈneɪbəz/

paragraphs.text: This past year has also seen some memorable and historic visits to Ireland and from America.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðɪs pɑːst jɪər hæz ˈɔːlsəʊ siːn sʌm ˈmɛmərəbl ænd hɪsˈtɒrɪk ˈvɪzɪts tuː ˈaɪələnd ænd frɒm əˈmɛrɪkə/

paragraphs.text: The spirit of friendship, so evident in both these nations, can fill us all with hope.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə ˈspɪrɪt əv ˈfrɛndʃɪp, səʊ ˈɛvɪdənt ɪn bəʊθ ðiːz ˈneɪʃənz, kæn fɪl ʌs ɔːl wɪð həʊp/

paragraphs.text: Relationships that years ago were once so strained, have through sorrow and forgiveness, blossomed in long-term friendship.
paragraphs.ipa: /rɪˈleɪʃənʃɪps ðæt jɪəz əˈɡəʊ wɜː wʌns səʊ streɪnd, hæv θruː ˈsɒrəʊ ænd fəˈɡɪvnɪs, ˈblɒsəmd ɪn ˈlɒŋtɜːm ˈfrɛndʃɪp/

paragraphs.text: It is through this lens of history that we should view the conflicts of today and so give us hope for tomorrow.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz θruː ðɪs lɛnz əv ˈhɪstəri ðæt wiː ʃʊd vjuː ðə ˈkɒnflɪkts əv təˈdeɪ ænd səʊ ɡɪv ʌs həʊp fɔː təˈmɒrəʊ/

paragraphs.text: Of course, family does not necessarily mean blood relatives, but often a description of a community, organisation or nation.
paragraphs.ipa: /əv kɔːs, ˈfæmɪli dʌz nɒt ˌnɛsɪˈsɛrɪli miːn blʌd ˈrɛlətɪvz, bʌt ˈɒfən ə dɪsˈkrɪpʃən əv ə kəˈmjuːnɪti, ˌɔːɡənaɪˈzeɪʃən ɔː ˈneɪʃən/

paragraphs.text: The Commonwealth is a family of 53 nations, all with a common bond, shared beliefs, mutual values and goals.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ ɪz ə ˈfæmɪli əv ˈfɪfti θriː ˈneɪʃənz, ɔːl wɪð ə ˈkɒmən bɒnd, ʃeəd bɪˈliːfs, ˈmjuːʧuəl ˈvæljuːz ænd ɡəʊlz/

paragraphs.text: It is this which makes the Commonwealth a family of people in the true sense.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz ðɪs wɪʧ meɪks ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ ə ˈfæmɪli əv ˈpiːpl ɪn ðə truː sɛns/

paragraphs.text: It is with each other enjoying its shared history and ready and willing to support its members in the direst of circumstances.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz wɪð iːʧ ˈʌðər ɪnˈʤɔɪɪŋ ɪts ʃeəd ˈhɪstəri ænd ˈrɛdi ænd ˈwɪlɪŋ tuː səˈpɔːt ɪts ˈmɛmbəz ɪn ðə ˈdaɪərɪst əv ˈsɜːkəmstənsɪz/

analysis.purpose: Highlight mutual support within the Commonwealth

paragraphs.text: They have always looked to the future with a sense of camaraderie, warmth and mutual respect while still maintaining their individualism.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðeɪ hæv ˈɔːlweɪz lʊkt tuː ðə ˈfjuːʧə wɪð ə sɛns əv ˌkæməˈrɑːdəri, wɔːmθ ænd ˈmjuːʧuəl rɪsˈpɛkt waɪl stɪl meɪnˈteɪnɪŋ ðeər ˌɪndɪˈvɪdjʊəlɪzəm/

paragraphs.text: The importance of family has of course come home to Prince Philip and me personally this year with the marriages of two of our grandchildren, each in their own way a celebration of the God-given love that binds a family together.
paragraphs.ipa: /ði ɪmˈpɔːtəns əv ˈfæmɪli hæz əv kɔːs kʌm həʊm tuː prɪns ˈfɪlɪp ænd miː ˈpɜːsənəli ðɪs jɪər wɪð ðə ˈmærɪʤɪz əv tuː əv ˈaʊə ˈɡrænˌʧɪldrən, iːʧ ɪn ðeər əʊn weɪ ə ˌsɛlɪˈbreɪʃən əv ðə ˈɡɒdˈɡɪvən lʌv ðæt baɪndz ə ˈfæmɪli təˈɡɛðə/

paragraphs.text: For many this Christmas will not be easy.
paragraphs.ipa: /fɔː ˈmɛni ðɪs ˈkrɪsməs wɪl nɒt biː ˈiːzi/

paragraphs.text: With our armed forces deployed around the world thousands of service families face Christmas without their loved ones at home.
paragraphs.ipa: /wɪð ˈaʊə ɑːmd ˈfɔːsɪz dɪˈplɔɪd əˈraʊnd ðə wɜːld ˈθaʊzəndz əv ˈsɜːvɪs ˈfæmɪliz feɪs ˈkrɪsməs wɪˈðaʊt ðeə lʌvd wʌnz æt həʊm/

paragraphs.text: The bereaved and the lonely will find it especially hard.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə bɪˈriːvd ænd ðə ˈləʊnli wɪl faɪnd ɪt ɪˈspɛʃəli hɑːd/

paragraphs.text: And as we all know the world is going through difficult times.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd æz wiː ɔːl nəʊ ðə wɜːld ɪz ˈɡəʊɪŋ θruː ˈdɪfɪkəlt taɪmz/

paragraphs.text: All this will affect our celebration of this great Christian festival.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɔːl ðɪs wɪl əˈfɛkt ˈaʊə ˌsɛlɪˈbreɪʃən əv ðɪs ɡreɪt ˈkrɪstʃən ˈfɛstɪvəl/

analysis.purpose: Connect struggles to the Christmas message

paragraphs.text: Finding hope in adversity is one of the themes of Christmas.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈfaɪndɪŋ həʊp ɪn ədˈvɜːsɪti ɪz wʌn əv ðə θiːmz əv ˈkrɪsməs/

paragraphs.text: Jesus was born into a world full of fear.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈʤiːzəs wɒz bɔːn ˈɪntuː ə wɜːld fʊl əv fɪə/

analysis.purpose: Relate Christmas story to current struggles

paragraphs.text: The angels came to frighten shepherds with hope in their voices.
paragraphs.ipa: /ði ˈeɪnʤəlz keɪm tuː ˈfraɪtn ˈʃɛpədz wɪð həʊp ɪn ðeə ˈvɔɪsɪz/

paragraphs.text: Fear not they urged we bring you tidings of great joy which will be to all people.
paragraphs.ipa: /fɪə nɒt ðeɪ ɜːʤd wiː brɪŋ juː ˈtaɪdɪŋz əv ɡreɪt ʤɔɪ wɪʧ wɪl biː tuː ɔːl ˈpiːpl/

paragraphs.text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David, a savior who is Christ the Lord.
paragraphs.ipa: /fɔːr ˈʌntuː juː ɪz bɔːn ðɪs deɪ ɪn ðə ˈsɪti əv ˈdeɪvɪd, ə ˈseɪvjə huː ɪz kraɪst ðə lɔːd/

paragraphs.text: Although we are capable of great acts of kindness history teaches us that we sometimes need saving from ourselves, from our recklessness or our greed.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɔːlˈðəʊ wiː ɑː ˈkeɪpəbl əv ɡreɪt ækts əv ˈkaɪndnɪs ˈhɪstəri ˈtiːʧɪz ʌs ðæt wiː ˈsʌmtaɪmz niːd ˈseɪvɪŋ frɒm aʊəˈsɛlvz, frɒm ˈaʊə ˈrɛkləsnɪs ɔːr ˈaʊə ɡriːd/

paragraphs.text: God sent into the world a unique person, neither a philosopher nor a general important there they are, but a savior with the power to forgive.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɡɒd sɛnt ˈɪntuː ðə wɜːld ə juːˈniːk ˈpɜːsən, ˈnaɪðər ə fɪˈlɒsəfə nɔːr ə ˈʤɛnərəl ɪmˈpɔːtənt ðeə ðeɪ ɑː, bʌt ə ˈseɪvjə wɪð ðə ˈpaʊə tuː fəˈɡɪv/

paragraphs.text: Forgiveness lies at the heart of the Christian faith.
paragraphs.ipa: /fəˈɡɪvnɪs laɪz æt ðə hɑːt əv ðə ˈkrɪstʃən feɪθ/

paragraphs.text: It can heal broken families.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt kæn hiːl ˈbrəʊkən ˈfæmɪliz/

paragraphs.text: It can restore friendships and it can reconcile divided communities.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt kæn rɪsˈtɔː ˈfrɛndʃɪps ænd ɪt kæn ˈrɛkənsaɪl dɪˈvaɪdɪd kəˈmjuːnɪtiz/

paragraphs.text: It is in forgiveness that we feel the power of God's love.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz ɪn fəˈɡɪvnɪs ðæt wiː fiːl ðə ˈpaʊə əv ɡɒdz lʌv/

paragraphs.text: In the last verse of this beautiful Carol, a little town of Bethlehem, there's a prayer to holy child of Bethlehem to send to us we pray.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ðə lɑːst vɜːs əv ðɪs ˈbjuːtɪfʊl ˈkærəl, ə ˈlɪtl taʊn əv ˈbɛθlɪhɛm, ðeəz ə preə tuː ˈhəʊli ʧaɪld əv ˈbɛθlɪhɛm tuː sɛnd tuː ʌs wiː preɪ/

paragraphs.text: Cast out our sin and enter in, be born in us today.
paragraphs.ipa: /kɑːst aʊt ˈaʊə sɪn ænd ˈɛntər ɪn, biː bɔːn ɪn ʌs təˈdeɪ/

analysis.purpose: Express a desire for spiritual renewal

paragraphs.text: It is my prayer that on this Christmas day we might all find room in our lives for the message of the angels and for the love of God through Christ our Lord.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz maɪ preə ðæt ɒn ðɪs ˈkrɪsməs deɪ wiː maɪt ɔːl faɪnd ruːm ɪn ˈaʊə laɪvz fɔːr ðə ˈmɛsɪʤ əv ði ˈeɪnʤəlz ænd fɔːr ðə lʌv əv ɡɒd θruː kraɪst ˈaʊə lɔːd/

paragraphs.text: I wish you all a very happy Christmas.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ wɪʃ juː ɔːl ə ˈvɛri ˈhæpi ˈkrɪsməs/
